Class UserQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • UserQuery

  • public class UserQuery
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    CS2334. Modified by: ?????

    Date: 2015-09-28
    Project 3

    This class is responsible for interacting with the user to identify the station and variable of interest, and to report the minimum, maximum and average statistics for the variable.

    • Method Detail

      • selectString

        public static java.lang.String selectString(java.io.BufferedReader br,
                            java.lang.String prompt,
                            java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> strings)
                                     throws java.io.IOException,
                                            UserQueryException
        Prompts the user for a string input. If the string matches a list of acceptable inputs, then the string is returned. If not, then the user is reprompted until a valid value is typed. Notes:
        • Assume that the list of acceptable values is composed of uppercase letters only
        • The returned value must be uppercased
        • If the user types "END", then an exception is generated
        Parameters:
        br - BufferedReader attached to the user's console
        prompt - String prompt used to ask for input from the user
        strings - The ArrayList of acceptable input strings
        Returns:
        The typed string
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an error occurs in reading input from the user
        UserQueryException - If "END" is typed.

      • stationMenu

        public static java.lang.String stationMenu(java.io.BufferedReader br,
                           StationInfoList stationList)
                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                           UserQueryException
        Query the user for a stationID.

        First prints out the list of stations (sorted by station IDs). Then, prompts the user for input.

        Parameters:
        br - BufferedReader from which input is received
        stationList - The set of stations, one of which may be selected.
        Returns:
        String station ID that has been selected
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an error occurs when reading from the BufferedReader
        UserQueryException - If the user indicates that s/he is done with the interaction

      • variableMenu

        public static java.lang.String variableMenu(java.io.BufferedReader br,
                            DataInfoList dataInfoList)
                                     throws java.io.IOException,
                                            UserQueryException
        Query the user for a variable ID.

        First prints out the list of variables (sorted by variable IDs). Then, prompts the user for input.

        Parameters:
        br - BufferedReader from which input is received
        dataInfoList - The set of variables, one of which may be selected.
        Returns:
        String variable ID that has been selected
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an error occurs when reading from the BufferedReader
        UserQueryException - If the user indicates that s/he is done with the interaction
